{"step_by_step_thinking": "The spinal cord is a major part of the central nervous system. It extends from the base of the brain to the lower back. In adults, the spinal cord typically ends at the level of the first lumbar vertebra (L1) or the upper part of the second lumbar vertebra (L2). However, it is more commonly at the level of L1.", "answer_choice": "B. L1"}
